revised_title: The Action of Oxygen on Copper Nitrate in a State of Tension: A Study of Electrochemical Deposition
tldr: This study investigates the interaction between copper and nitrate of silver in solution, observing the deposition of a copper suboxide layer on silver crystals. The authors find that this deposition occurs when oxygen is present and is accompanied by a corresponding dissolution of copper. They also explore the possibility of replacing elements in the reaction and discuss the initiation of the chemical change near the more negative metal.
